title: Google Pixel 4 Plans: Telstra, Optus And Vodafone
text:
Screenshot: David Murphy

Google's fourth-generation Pixel is now available to pre-order in Australia. Like the Nexus range before it, the Google Pixel 4 is the ultimate Android smartphone, providing instant OS updates, peerless photography software and the latest Google apps. It's also more affordable than the equivalent flagships from Apple and Samsung. Here are all the plans from Telstra, Optus and Vodafone with links to buy!

The Pixel 4 costs $1049 to buy outright. If you don't have that kind of money lying around, your best bet is to pick it up on a mobile phone contract. Here are all the plans currently being offered by Australia's major telcos.

Pixel 4 plans: Telstra

Telstra's Pixel 4 pricing starts at $79.13 a month, which nets you 15GB data. However, to get that price you need to stick with the plan for 36 months. (There's no lock-in contract, but you will need to pay off the remainder of the phone price if you decide to cancel.) Telstra's top plan will set you back $153.29 a month - that one comes with a more generous 150GB of data and a shorter 24-month contract.

Bonus: Telstra is offering a free Google Nest Hub if you sign up before January 13, 2020.

Our pick: 60GB Medium Mobile Plan ($89.13 per month).

Pixel 4 plans: Vodafone

Vodafone's cheapest plan will set you back $64.13 a month. However, that plan only comes with a paltry 5GB of data. The most expensive option is $124.54 over 24 months - that ups the data cap to 120GB.

Bonus: Customers who sign up to a Red Plan or Red Plus Plan before 23 October will receive a bonus JBL Link 10 Wireless Portable Speaker valued at $229.

Our pick: 30GB 'Endless Data' Red Plus Plan for $88.70 per month.

Pixel 4 plans: Optus

Optus' cheapest plan costs $70 a month on a 36-month plan. Unfortunately, it only comes with 4GB data which is even worse than what Vodafone is offering.

Bonus: Optus will throw in a Harman Kardon Citation One Speaker if you order before December 31.
